law.catch_line: Liability for conduct of another -- Exemptions.
law.text:
A person is not guilty under KRS 502.010 or 502.020 for an offense committed by another person when:
The offense is so defined that his conduct is inevitably incident to its commission; or
Prior to the commission of the offense, he manifests a voluntary and complete renunciation, as defined in KRS 506.060, of his criminal purposes and:
Deprives his prior effort of its effectiveness in such commission; or
Gives timely warning to the proper law enforcement authorities or otherwise makes proper effort to prevent commission of the offense.
law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 23, effective January 1, 1975.
